items.title: All NASA News - NASA
items.content_text: Stay up-to-date with the latest content from NASA as we explore the universe and discover more about our home planet.

items.title: NASA News
items.content_text: Resources for news media, including NASA news contacts and archived news material

items.title: NASA, Blue Origin Invite Media to Attend Mars Mission Launch - NASA
items.content_text: NASA and Blue Origin are reopening media accreditation for the launch of the agency’s ESCAPADE (Escape and Plasma Acceleration and Dynamics Explorers)

items.title: NASA, International Partners Deepen Commitment to Artemis Accords - NASA
items.content_text: NASA, along with leaders from global space agencies and government representatives worldwide, convened on Monday to further the implementation of the Artemis

items.title: 2025 News Releases - NASA
items.content_text: Sign up to receive NASA news releases and other information.

items.title: Crew Works Advanced Science Hardware and Conducts Lab Inspections - NASA
items.content_text: Space science hardware once again topped the schedule for the Expedition 73 crew aboard the International Space Station on Tuesday. Life support and electronics maintenance to keep the orbital outpost in tip-top shape filled the rest of the day for the space lab residents.

items.title: Crew Begins Week Configuring Advanced Physics, Space Tech Demo Hardware - NASA
items.content_text: Science hardware was the focus on Monday as the Expedition 73 crew configured foam and material physics research gear and installed a space technology demonstration. Meanwhile, blood circulation studies and cargo operations rounded out the day aboard the International Space Station.

items.title: NASA-ISRO Satellite Sends First Radar Images of Earth’s Surface
items.content_text: Preliminary images from the most powerful Earth radar satellite ever launched offer a tantalizing glimpse of the science the mission will be able to deliver.

items.title: NASA’s Webb Explores Largest Star-Forming Cloud in Milky Way
items.content_text: Webb’s MIRI, managed by NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory through launch, helped reveal the star-studded Sagittarius B2 molecular cloud in unprecedented detail.

items.title: NASA’s Deep Space Communications Demo Exceeds Project Expectations
items.content_text: The project has exceeded all of its technical goals after two years, setting up the foundations of high-speed communications for NASA’s future human missions to Mars.

items.title: NASA’s Tally of Planets Outside Our Solar System Reaches 6,000
items.content_text: The milestone highlights the accelerating rate of discoveries, just over three decades since the first exoplanets were found.

items.title: NASA Analysis Shows Sun’s Activity Ramping Up
items.content_text: It looked like the Sun was heading toward a historic lull in activity. That trend flipped in 2008, according to new research.

items.title: NASA’s GUARDIAN Tsunami Detection Tech Catches Wave in Real Time
items.content_text: A massive earthquake and subsequent tsunami off Russia in late July tested an experimental detection system that had deployed a critical component just the day before.

items.title: New U.S.-European Sea Level Satellite Will Help Safeguard Ships at Sea
items.content_text: Sea surface height data from the Sentinel-6B satellite, led by NASA and ESA, will help with the development of marine weather forecasts, alerting ships to possible dangers.

items.title: NASA Says Mars Rover Discovered Potential Biosignature Last Year
items.content_text: After a year’s worth of scientific scrutiny, the ‘Sapphire Canyon’ rock sample remains the mission’s best candidate for containing signs of ancient microbial life processes.

items.title: NASA-ISRO Satellite Lifts Off to Track Earth’s Changing Surfaces
items.content_text: The first-of-its kind satellite will provide actionable information in a range of areas, including disaster response, infrastructure monitoring, and agricultural management.

items.title: News
items.content_text: NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory, the leading center for robotic exploration of the solar system.

items.title: Submit a Media Inquiry | Blue Origin
items.content_text: If you’re a member of the press, please contact us at media@blueorigin.com with your inquiry and deadline.

items.title: Gallery | Blue Origin
items.content_text: Images available for download. Please credit Blue Origin.

items.title: Blue Origin Announces Crew for New Shepard’s 36th Mission | Blue Origin
items.content_text: Blue Origin announced the next crew flying on its NS-36 mission. The crew includes: Jeff Elgin, Danna Karagussova, Dr. Clint Kelly III, Aaron Newman, Vitalii Ostrovsky, and an undisclosed sixth crew member.

items.title: Blue Origin and Luxembourg Partner on Oasis-1 Mission to Map Lunar Resources | Blue Origin
items.content_text: Blue Origin today announced Project Oasis, a multi-phase initiative to identify key lunar resources from orbit, assess them on the ground, and harness them in situ.

items.title: Florida Investment Matches Our Ambitious Growth Plans | Blue Origin
items.content_text: Blue Origin employs nearly 4,000 people in Brevard County and has invested over $2.3 billion with 500 suppliers in Florida, generating significant economic growth and employment in the region.

items.title: Blue Origin Completes 35th New Shepard Mission | Blue Origin
items.content_text: Blue Origin successfully completed its 35th New Shepard flight and 15th payload mission today from Launch Site One in West Texas.
